tweets.text: Lots of visits @SOPH_C_ but the fumes have been worse over the w/e and early this week for us in particular.Lots of hot air from @EnvAgency & lots of üí© air from @RedIndustries2 . @AaronBell4NUL @MattHancock @PHE_uk @EnvAgencyMids Hold @ClareDinnisEA @JamesBevanEA to account... Action is needed immediately, health issues and the stink grows worse by the day... it‚Äôs out of control #stopthestink @PHE_uk act before it‚Äôs too late for the health of many

tweets.text: @EnvAgency Pleased about additional monitors for #WalleysQuarry but unless staff are visiting the area overnight you will still have no concept of how bad the odour gets. Remember you failed to substantiate the @WHO breaking odour's existence using odour patrols! @StinkStopthe

There were 1168 reports about a bad smell in the Newcastle-under-Lyme area last week says @EnvAgency 

Because of an increase in complaints the EA says it visited Walleys Quarry landfill on Tuesday to investigate the reason. (Waiting to find out if they found one) https://t.co/tyCbwmFthp

1,168 complaints to the @EnvAgency in 6 days - the only reason they are now taking some form of action even though it‚Äôs not as stringent as it should be. Keep up the reporting - it‚Äôs forcing them to listen @BBCPanorama @StinkStopthe @itvnews #panorama https://t.co/wgy76rYwCx

tweets.text: @poppers82 @EnvAgencyMids @scottdegg @AaronBell4NUL ea statement-they balance environment ,human needs against allowing landfill permits, wonder which comes first @ClareDinnisEA cos it's not humans, you treat the rats better you don't poison them, you concede as did @RedIndustries can't control the toxic gases, #StopTheStink

@AaronBell4NUL Additional monitoring is encouraging but I'm disappointed there's been no further release of data by @EnvAgencyMids or @PHE_uk since the single bit of info that the @WHO health guideline was exceeded on one day. I'm sure more could be available. @StinkStopthe

Can they really call themselves the Environment Agency when they‚Äôve sent out pointless letters to the whole of Newcastle and parts of Stoke? What a waste of paper! @EnvAgencyMids @ClareDinnisEA @JamesBevanEA #StopTheStink

Nice to see freshwater mussels filtering the water in the Spring sunshine. First survey of the season ‚Äì very chilly! ü•∂

tweets.text: üí®So the wind direction swings around again and the south & west of the Borough get the brunt of the stink this evening. The operator is now halfway to @EnvAgencyMids deadline to reduce the odours without any success. What is the EA‚Äôs plan B? @StinkStopthe @AaronBell4NUL https://t.co/5Ssb90uU4h

Never in my life in the UK did I think fresh air would be a luxury but this is our life now in #newcastleunderlyme A family member has taken me to get the freshest air because where I live cant provide us with that anymore.

@EnvAgencyMids @BBCPanorama @StinkStopthe #STOPTHESTINK https://t.co/Dv2UXf6ZbA

Project Officer Lauren Davidson is featured in today's Yorkshire Post in the 'Business Voices' section, where she talks about the benefits of installing property flood resilience measures for businesses and landlords.
#YorkshireFloodResilience https://t.co/iYQpb0fJSJ

@poppers82 @EnvAgencyMids @scottdegg So all within permit, and therein lies the problem, too many extensions and changes to what is allowed in landfill feet from human life, @AaronBell4NUL labour govt forced this upon us years ago as non toxic, non odour builders waste, rubble, bricks, new permits disgrace.

@BarnetLabour @sianberry @NaturalEngland @CanalRiverTrust @Brent_Council @CPRELondon @EnvAgency @WildLondon @BarnetCouncil @Thames21 In case you were wondering, I took the pic of the heron in the reeds at Welsh Harp on Monday.

tweets.text:
The River Usk in south Wales is supposed to be protected. 

But we've discovered that untreated sewage is being illegally dumped in the river.

https://t.co/dOzQqKqXWw https://t.co/ddm57g5liN

Read our latest update for #WalleysQuarry landfill site here üëâhttps://t.co/o558iAVicn

We're visiting the surrounding area on an almost daily basis to carry out odour amenity checks. We're also continuing to inspect the site, including monitoring the progress of the capping. https://t.co/FsLQlvsU0f

@EnvAgencyMids @scottdegg Still don‚Äôt give a s**t in my opinion. We just want to know why we are being gassed in our own homes. Just let us know what your doing to stop the odious smell from coming into my safe space please. You need to cover SOT when monitoring odours also it‚Äôs not just NUL by the way

I grew up living a few hundred metres from a landfill site in Sneyd Green in the 1990s and I don't remember ever even smelling anything from it, let alone being unwell. @RedIndustries2 maybe you could take some tips from how they did it in the olden days #stopthestink  @EnvAgency

Don‚Äôt forget to register now for our free #preventingplasticpollution virtual workshop for businesses to be held at 10-12 on Monday 19 April co-hosted by @EnvAgency & @GreentechSouth as part of our @Plastic_EU project. @BITCenvironment @hantschamber @solentlep https://t.co/gJqnHzRe4a
@KurtRockin @BorisJohnson @MattHancock @AaronBell4NUL @EnvAgencyMids This is my home right now! Over 200 is unsafe. https://t.co/6M8CXf7TFj
